content.headline: Tech, cruises, Abercrombie: Top 2023 stock performances
content.summary: Tesla (TSLA), Nvidia (NVDA), and Apple (AAPL) — three of the Magnificent Seven tech stocks — have seen huge gains in 2023, riding the waves of various technology and AI trends. But the tech trade is not the only industry that has benefitted this past year. Yahoo Finance Live examines several other outperformers across industries, including cruise operators Royal Caribbean Cruises (RCL) and Carnival Corp. (CCL), and even retail chain Abercrombie & Fitch (ANF). Solar energy stocks disappointed in 2023 as significant players saw big annual losses. For more expert insight and the latest market action, click here to watch this full episode of Yahoo Finance Live.

content.headline: 'Trillion-dollar club' companies reach combined $10T in 2023
content.summary: The combined market cap of US companies valued over a trillion dollars has reached $10 trillion in 2023, doubling from the previous year. Apple (AAPL) leads with a market cap worth over $3 trillion, followed by Microsoft (MSFT), Alphabet (GOOG, GOOGL), Amazon (AMZN), and Nvidia (NVDA). Yahoo Finance Market Reporter Jared Blikre breaks down these numbers, comparing the market share of these tech giants to their values from before the pandemic. For more expert insight and the latest market action, click here to watch this full episode of Yahoo Finance Live.

content.headline: AI, taxes, real estate, healthcare: Best of 2023 theme weeks
content.summary: From EVs and student loans, to retail and retirement, Yahoo Finance covered it all in 2023. As investors begin to look to what’s in store for the year ahead, our experts help set the stage. Here are some of the highlights from Yahoo Finance's theme weeks. Taxes (00:00:03) As part of the Yahoo Finance's Ultimate Tax Guide weekly series, Dan Geltrude, Geltrude & Company Founder, broke down some of the most important changes in the tax code for 2023. Geltrude said, "Good news. The standard deductions are larger this year. The Child Tax Credit, a little bit smaller this year. Also, the expansion of the Child and Dependent Care Credit is expiring." Real Estate (00:00:27) Shark Tank star and The Corcoran Group Founder Barbara Corcoran thinks that now is the absolute best time to buy a home. As part of Yahoo Finance's weekly series Real Estate: The New Reality, Corcoran said, "I think it's the absolute best time to buy a home. There's nothing in my logic that says it makes sense to wait. You ought to jump in now and get the house while you can." Retirement (00:00:39) Opportunity Knock$ Financial Coach Jean Chatzky believes that it is best to weigh one's income streams against their biggest expenses, including where you live, far ahead of retirement. As part of Yahoo Finance's weekly series Retirement Readiness: Planning Your Future, Chatzky said, "The first thing that you have to do is figure out what your retirement looks like ... When are you retiring? Where are you retiring? What will you do day-to-day in your retirement?" Retail (00:01:05) As part of Yahoo Finance's week-long series Retail Evolution: The New Era, Tanger Outlets (SKT) CEO Stephen Yalof discussed the uptick in outlet mall shopping and the new-found approachability of luxury brands. Yalof said, "Outlet centers are value shopping experiences for people that are looking to buy brands at the best possible price. And in this environment right now, that's what the customer is looking for." Student Loans (00:01:17) The Biden administration's Public Service Loan Relief program has saved borrowers billions of dollars. American Federation of Teachers President Randi Weingarten joined Yahoo Finance as part of the weekly series Student Loans: Smarter Strategies. Weingarten explained, "The President is trying to put into place things that will help people who go to college. And we should be really helping people go to college, and doing it in an affordable way." EVs (00:01:31) As part of Yahoo Finance's weekly series EVs: The Road Ahead, Blink Charging (BLNK) President and CEO Brendan Jones and Plug In America Executive Director Joel Levin discussed the most important challenges behind the EV charging infrastructure. Jones believes that consumers need to break the trend of fueling at a station rather than using reliable home chargers. He explained, "We have to break the dominant paradigm of charging by saying, you don't have to go to a depot or fuel station. You can charge at work. You can charge at home." Healthcare (00:01:41) Amazon (AMZN) has made a big push into the healthcare industry. Amazon Pharmacy Chief Medical Officer Dr. Vin Gupta joins Yahoo Finance as part of the weekly series Healthcare: Industry Checkup to describe how Amazon Pharmacy delivers prescriptions directly to customers' doors. Dr. Vin Gupta said, "All these feature sets are really set to address the biggest problem in healthcare, which is patient information, patient awareness of services, of products that can actually result in lower costs to them for their prescription medications." Top stories of 2023 (00:02:04) It has been quite the year for artificial intelligence. Yahoo Finance’s Dan Howley takes a look at the year AI has had as part of Yahoo Finance's Countdown: Top Stories of 2023. “To say that 2023 was the year of AI, would be the understatement of, well, the year,” Howley said. "It started in November 2022 with the release of ChatGPT by OpenAI. The chatbot quickly became the fastest growing app in history, to that point,” hitting 100 million users in two months. In May 2023, Nvidia’s (NVDA) market value “briefly topped $1 trillion dollars for the first time, cementing its status as the AI chip leader.” Investor Guide (00:02:40) The Magnificent Seven didn't just dominate the markets this year, they also topped the list of the most trafficked ticker pages on Yahoo Finance. Tesla (TSLA), Nvidia, Apple (AAPL), Amazon, and Microsoft (MSFT) topped the ranking. Yahoo Finance's Jared Blikre broke down the list as part of the weekly series 2024 Investor Guide. "Not surprisingly in a year that was all about the mega caps, the Mag Seven, they dominate the top ten most popular pages visited by you on the Yahoo Finance app and website," Blikre said. "And the winner by far is Tesla ... that was seen over 300 million times this year."

content.headline: 3 important things pros say you should watch out for in the stock market for 2024
content.summary: The stock market may currently be on autopilot, but that doesn't mean to get complacent. Here are a couple things to watch out for in 2024.

content.headline: Can Magnificent 7 stocks sustain market dominance in 2024?
content.summary: The Magnificent Seven stocks — Apple (AAPL), Microsoft (MSFT), Alphabet (GOOG, GOOGL), Amazon (AMZN), Meta (META), Tesla (TSLA), and Nvidia (NVDA) — dominated the tech landscape in 2023, and Constellation Research Founder and Principal Analyst R "Ray" Wang believes they could "definitely" continue leading into 2024 after driving two-thirds of the S&P 500's (^GSPC) gains. Wang attributes their outperformance to AI, digital networks, and unmatched revenue growth. These core strengths with wide enterprise adoption position them to maintain index sway. Beyond the Magnificent Seven, Wang highlighted other names like Oracle (ORCL) and ServiceNow (NOW) also poised to "benefit from the AI boom." For more expert insight and the latest market action, click here to watch this full episode of Yahoo Finance Live.

content.headline: Buffett's traditional style prevails amid A.I. hype
content.summary: Warren Buffett, CEO of Berkshire Hathaway, (BRK-A, BRK-B) enters the new year with over 40 holdings in the company's portfolio—including Occidental Petroleum (OXY), Apple (AAPL), and BYD Company (BYDDY). While these stocks have garnered attention thanks to having Berkshire as an investor, Buffett's traditional investment style, focusing on solid fundamentals, contrasts with the high valuations and non-traditional nature of A.I. plays. Yahoo Finance’s Brian Sozzi and Bradley Smith take a closer look at potential shifts in Buffett’s investment strategy and whether A.I could be in view. For more expert insight and the latest market action, click here to watch this full episode of Yahoo Finance Live.

content.headline: AI, Magnificent 7 highlight biggest takeaways from 2023
content.summary: 2023 was a tumultuous year for the economy and the world at large. With ongoing and escalating geopolitical conflicts, a banking crisis, inflation, volatility, chaos in Congress, and more, there's a lot to sift through. Yahoo Finance anchors Brad Smith and Brian Sozzi take a look back at the year, their biggest takeaways, and dive deep into the concept of 'Hopeium,' driven by generative AI and the Magnificent Seven stocks.For more expert insight and the latest market action, click here to watch this full episode of Yahoo Finance Live.

content.headline: China’s Luxshare expands Apple production capacity in deepening relationship
content.summary: Apple supplier Luxshare is taking over an iPhone assembly factory from Taiwanese rival Pegatron, as the Chinese contract manufacturer deepens its relationship with the US technology giant.  Luxshare will pay about $300mn to acquire a 62.5 per cent stake in a facility in Kunshan, a city of 1.6mn people north-west of Shanghai, according to a Pegatron filing on the Taipei Exchange.  In Asia morning trading on Friday, Luxshare shares rose 4 per cent in Shenzhen while Pegatron’s shares dropped 4 per cent in Taipei.

content.headline: Apple is 'behind the curve' on generative AI: Analyst
content.summary: In 2023, the tech sector has displayed significant growth, particularly driven by the adoption of generative AI models. TECHnalysis Research, LLC President and Chief Analyst Bob O'Donnell joins Yahoo Finance Live to discuss key trends and companies shaping this growth. “Most people in their jobs, have yet to experience it [generative AI],” O'Donnell states, who notes the rollout is just the beginning for most companies and expects an “explosion” for companies such as Microsoft (MSFT) and Alphabet (GOOG, GOOGL). While several of the Magnificent Seven tech stocks have ventured into the artificial intelligence space, O'Donnell believes that Apple (AAPL) is falling behind its competition. “Apple is behind the curve, on this one,” O'Donnell says. For more expert insight and the latest market action, click here to watch this full episode of Yahoo Finance Live.

content.headline: Apple's Chinese Partner Luxshare Set to Transform iPhone Production Landscape with Major Acquisition
content.summary: Apple Inc (NASDAQ: AAPL) Chinese partner, Luxshare Precision Industry Co, is poised to take over an iPhone assembly site from Taiwanese competitor Pegatron Corp. This move is part of Apple's strategy to strengthen ties with China-based suppliers and enhance relations with Beijing. Luxshare is acquiring a 62.5% stake in Pegatron's Kunshan unit in eastern China for approximately 2.1 billion yuan ($300 million), Bloomberg cites a recent exchange filing. Huawei and Xiaomi, whose phones battle the iPhone for supremacy in China, both released new cars this week with advanced digital features.

content.headline: Tired Rally? Heavy 0DTE, Yield Curve Spreads, Empty Piggy Bank, 'Watching' Apple
content.summary: The December version of the Richmond Fed Manufacturing Index, arguably the second most important regional manufacturing survey in the country (behind Philadelphia), printed in the hole, dropping at the headline to -11 from November's -5.  This came one day after the Dallas Fed Manufacturing Index printed for December in contraction for a jaw dropping 20th consecutive month.  This forced traders into Treasury debt securities, as the yield for the U.S. 10-Year Note dropped 10 basis points to 3.79% and the yield for the U.S. 2-Year Note dropped 11 basis points to 4.24% (Both of these products have found some overnight support at these levels).

content.headline: Predictions: Apple’s $4tn target will remain out of reach
content.summary: In 2024, Apple will release its first new hardware product in close to a decade. content.headline: UPDATE 1-India's govt demanded Apple soften impact of hack warnings -Washington Post
content.summary: Apple's warnings in October to Indian opposition politicians that government hackers may have hacked their phones prompted Prime Minister Narendra Modi's administration to quickly demand the U.S. firm soften its message, the Washington Post reported.  Apple's India representatives were called by administration officials who demanded that company help weaken the political impact of the warnings, the newspaper said citing three unidentified sources.  An Apple security expert was also summoned from outside the country to a meeting in New Delhi and the expert was pressed to come up with alternative explanations for the warnings, it said.

content.headline: Apple Can Restart Watch Sales as U.S. Court Pauses Ban
content.summary: The federal agency’s import ban included Apple’s Series 9 and Ultra 2 models.  Apple  won a temporary reprieve for its $18 billion smartwatch business after a U.S. appeals court on Wednesday paused a federal agency’s import ban on most of its watch models.  The ruling will allow sales to resume in the coming weeks while the court weighs Apple’s request to pause the ban pending its appeal of an October decision by the U.S. International Trade Commission.

The U.S. International Trade Commission in October ordered Apple to stop importing and selling some Apple Watches following a complaint from medical-monitoring technology company Masimo .

content.headline: Apple gets a huge win in its Apple Watch patent saga
content.summary: It has been quite the roller coaster ride for Apple  over the past couple of days as the company fights to sell one of its most popular products in the U.S.  On Wednesday, the company won a temporary pause of a sales ban on the Apple Watch that went into effect on Tuesday.  A patent dispute with medical device maker Masimo  led the U.S. International Trade Commission to ban the sale of the device in the States, but a federal appeals court ordered that the sales ban be paused following a request from Apple.

content.headline: Where you can still buy the latest Apple Watch
content.summary: Now that the White House declined to overturn the ITC ruling, Apple can no longer sell its newest Apple Watch in America. The rule applies to Apple Watch Series 9 and Apple Watch Ultra 2, among other newer models, because they violate patents registered to another company.

content.headline: Apple Watch ban temporarily paused by US court
content.summary: A federal appeals court has temporarily paused the ban on the import and sale of the Apple Watch Series 9 and Ultra 2 models in the United States. Apple (AAPL) had been forced to stop selling the watches in the US after the International Trade Commission determined it had infringed on patents held by medical technology company Masimo (MASI). Yahoo Finance's Josh Lipton and Julie Hyman have the latest details, including the January 12 deadline for US Customs agents to review Apple's adjustments to its watches.
